question: Universal Containers uses a custom picklist field Account Region on the account record. They want this region to be reflected on all related contact records and stay in sync if the value of this field changes on the Account. How should an app builder meet this requirement?
options: Create a text field called 'Account Region' on Contact object and a workflow to update it.
Create a picklist field called 'Account Region' on Contact object and a lookup relationship.
Create a formula field on the Contact object using ISPICKVAL.
Create a formula field on the Contact object using the TEXT function.
explanation: Formula fields are the standard way to display parent record fields on child records in real-time without maintenance.

question: An app builder wants to create a custom Sync button on Account that will call a Lightning Web Component that connects with an external system. This action should only be available if the custom Status field is set to Ready to Sync. What should an app builder use to add this functionality to an Account record page?
explanation: Dynamic Actions allow you to set visibility rules for buttons based on field values directly on the Lightning record page.

question: DreamHouse Realty has a mentorship program that pairs experienced Realtors with new Realtors. Each experienced Realtor can mentor one or several new Realtors, and each new Realtor is required to work with a single experienced Realtor they report to. Which type of relationship would an app builder set up?
explanation: A lookup relationship allows a child record (new Realtor) to be linked to one parent (Mentor), supporting a 1-to-many model.

question: Universal Containers deployed an app in a large change set to a sandbox for testing. After testing, changes had to be made to several components. How should an app builder move the new changes to the target sandbox?
options: Clone the change set and re-deploy.
Refresh the test sandbox and re-deploy the change set.
Update the change set and re-deploy.
Rename the change set, add the changes and re-deploy.
explanation: Uploaded change sets cannot be modified. Cloning the change set is the required step to add new components or fixes.

question: Universal Containers sales reps can modify fields on an opportunity until it is closed. Sales operations needs to modify two specific fields after it is closed, while others become read-only for reps. How should these requirements be met?
options: Use field-level security to mark fields as read-only on the Sales profile.
Use record types with field sets and restrict editing fields using field-level security.
Use field-level security on page layouts to restrict editing fields.
Use multiple record types, page layouts, validation rules and profiles.
explanation: This requires switching record types upon closure to apply a different page layout and using validation rules to prevent editing by specific profiles.

question: An app builder is creating a custom object called Testimonial. If the Account is deleted, the Testimonial records should also be deleted. If the Contact is deleted, but the Account remains, the Testimonial records should remain. How should this be accomplished?
options: Lookup to Account and Master-detail to Contact.
Junction object between Account and Contact using master-detail.
Required lookup relationships to both objects.
Master-detail to Account and a lookup relationship to Contact.
explanation: Master-detail relationship triggers a cascade delete from the parent (Account), while a lookup allows the record to persist if the other parent (Contact) is deleted.

question: Ursa Major Solar agents want a condensed case view and the ability to modify associated contact and account records from the case page. Which two components should be used?
explanation: Tabs help organize the page to save space, and the Related Record component allows editing fields of related records directly.

question: Cloud Kicks (CK) wants to quickly insert a list of over 1 million net new Accounts. Which tool should be used?
explanation: Data Loader is the only standard tool capable of handling imports exceeding the 50,000 record limit of the Import Wizard.

question: DreamHouse Realty wants to import property records using an external ID field. Which two details should the app builder know when using external ID fields?
options: Each object can have up to 25 custom external ID fields.
An external ID field can be an auto-number field.
Each org can have up to 25 custom external ID fields.
An external ID field can be a URL field.
explanation: Salesforce limits external IDs to 25 per object. Auto-number fields are one of the supported types for external IDs.

question: Ursa Major Solar wants to concatenate Street, City, Planet, and Galaxy fields into a single formula field on two lines. Which formula fulfills this?
explanation: The BR() function is required to insert a line break in a formula field.

question: AW Computing needs to capture many different help requests per Opportunity. The date of the most recent request should be displayed on the Opportunity. What should be used?
options: Opportunity with Master-detail field to custom object.
Custom object with Master-detail field to Opportunity.
Custom object with Lookup field to Opportunity.
Opportunity with Lookup field to custom object.
explanation: A master-detail relationship on the help request object (child) to the Opportunity (parent) enables the use of Roll-up Summary fields.

question: Which two are key considerations when using unmanaged packages?
options: A namespace is required to create an unmanaged package.
The person who created the package has no control over installed components.
A namespace is not required to create an unmanaged package.
The person who created the package can upgrade installed components.
explanation: Unmanaged packages do not use namespaces, and once installed, they are independent of the source and cannot be upgraded.

question: What are three capabilities of Process Builder that improve productivity?
explanation: Process Builder can create records, update related records, and send email alerts, but it cannot delete records or send outbound messages.

question: Ursa Major Solar wants to provide agents with a checklist of items that must be accomplished when servicing a case. What should be used?
explanation: The Actions & Recommendations component guides agents through a series of steps (flows or actions) as a checklist.

question: Which three options are available when activating a Lightning page from the Lightning App Builder?
options: Assign the page to a combination of apps and profiles.
Make the page the default homepage for specific apps.
Make the page the org default.
Assign the page to a combination of apps and permission sets.
Make the page the default homepage for specific roles.
explanation: Activation options include setting the page as Org Default, App Default, or App and Profile specific.

question: A service coordinator (SC) needs to modify data or remove attachments on work orders owned by others in a private data model. Which solution provides the required access?
options: Create an SC sharing rule and a corresponding public group.
Change work order access on the SC profile to 'Modify All'.
explanation: Sharing rules grant record-level access to groups of users in a private sharing model.

question: The CFO needs to sign off on any deal with a discount of more than 30% before the deal can be closed. Which feature should be used?
explanation: Approval processes are designed for formal record sign-offs based on specific entry criteria.

question: An app builder deployed a report via change set, but it returns no data in the target environment. What is the reason?
options: Data is deployed when added to a change set.
Data is unable to be deployed with change sets.
Reports have to be manually re-created in each environment.
Reports have to be deployed with Salesforce DX.
explanation: Change sets only deploy metadata (the report definition), not the actual data stored in records.

question: Which two solutions prevent a formula field from being referenced by a Roll-Up Summary field?
options: The NOW() function in the formula field.
A cross-object formula updating a field referenced by the formula field.
The CASE() function in the formula field.
A cross-object field reference in the formula field.
explanation: Roll-up summaries cannot reference formulas containing dynamic functions (like NOW) or fields from related objects.

question: DreamHouse Realty wants field value changes for 'Asking Price' and 'Agent' on their House object to show up on Chatter. Which feature should be used?
explanation: Feed Tracking enables automatic Chatter posts whenever specified fields on a record are updated.

question: An app builder wants to create a custom object and 10 fields quickly from one place. What should they use?
explanation: Schema Builder allows the visual creation of objects and fields in a single drag-and-drop interface.

question: DR executives want to automate the submission of travel request forms to enforce internal policy. Which automation tool should be used?
explanation: Enforcing policies for request submissions is the primary use case for an Approval Process.

question: Universal Containers wants managers to quickly provide sign off on discounted opportunities via the record page. Which two features should be used?
explanation: An approval process manages the logic, and dynamic actions can display the approval button conditionally on the record page.

question: UC wants to delete data in several fields for 5,000 Lead records using a CSV. Which two steps are required?
options: Select 'Insert Null Values' in Data Loader settings.
Use Data Loader to update leads using the CSV file.
Use Import Wizard to update leads using the CSV file.
explanation: Data Loader is needed for bulk updates. To clear fields, the 'Insert Null Values' setting must be enabled.

question: Cloud Kicks wants to know the total value of all won Opportunities for Accounts and display it on the record. Which type of summary should be used?
explanation: The 'Sum' operation in a Roll-up Summary field adds up the currency or numeric values of related records.

question: An app builder created a custom object with lookups to two different objects. What is needed to create 'with' or 'without' reports?
explanation: Custom Report Types allow you to define relationships between objects, including 'A with or without B' logic.

question: A sandbox environment needs to include 500MB of data, use templates, and be refreshed weekly. Which sandbox meets this?
explanation: Partial Copy sandboxes support templates, have a 5GB data limit, and can be refreshed every 5 days.

question: Which two considerations should an app builder keep in mind when deploying via change sets?
options: Transactions will revert if the deployment errors.
Change sets do not include all components and may require manual changes.
Salesforce Connect establishes a link between environments.
Users should be logged out of production during deployment.
explanation: Deployments are atomic (rollback on error). Not all metadata is supported by change sets, requiring manual post-deployment steps.

question: Campaign members are required to have a sales owner. Which validation rule should be configured?
options: A rule checking the profile of the owner.
A rule checking if the owner is a queue.
A rule ensuring the Owner field is not blank and not a queue.
A rule checking the lead source.
explanation: Validation rules can prevent records from being saved if the owner is left blank or remains assigned to a queue.

question: What is the effect on reporting when changing a relationship from master-detail to lookup?
options: Existing reports created under the 'with' report type will be deleted.
Existing roll-up summary fields will be deleted from the object and reports.
Existing roll-up summary fields will remain but no longer update.
Existing reports will be unusable but not deleted.
explanation: Converting to lookup deletes master-detail based report types and removes all associated roll-up summary fields.

question: DreamHouse Realty wants to prevent cases from being reverted to an earlier status and ensure certain fields are required conditionally. Which solution?
explanation: Validation rules using PRIORVALUE can prevent status regressions and enforce conditional field requirements.

question: What are three things an app builder should do to optimize the mobile experience?
options: Use Global Actions to make vital functionality easy to access.
Minimize the amount of formula and lookup fields to reduce load time.
Create customized layouts for different phone operating systems.
Put the most important fields in the compact layout.
explanation: Global actions, minimizing complex fields, and using compact layouts are key best practices for mobile usability and performance.

question: Which sandbox type should be considered first for small projects before collaborative testing to keep costs down?
explanation: Developer sandboxes are the most cost-effective (free) and suitable for initial development and small projects.

question: When a lift is sold, an external system should be notified via an outbound message the next day. Which tool should be used?
explanation: Flows can handle scheduled paths and send outbound messages to external systems.

question: The recruiting team wants the 'Years of Previous Experience' field to display only if 'Previous Experience' is checked. Which functionality should be used?
options: Create two page layouts and a process to switch them.
Use Dynamic Forms to display the field conditionally.
explanation: Dynamic Forms allow for component and field visibility rules based on the record's field values.

question: How can an app builder help achieve business card data entry goals without sacrificing quality?
options: Post missing fields to Chatter daily.
Use Flow to create a data entry wizard.
Evaluate data enrichment products on the AppExchange.
Use a formula field to populate keys.
explanation: AppExchange offers various data enrichment and business card scanning solutions to automate data entry.

question: How can a filter be utilized to show only Chatter posts from key account and opportunity records?
explanation: Chatter streams allow users to aggregate feeds from multiple related records into a single customized view.

question: Universal Containers (UC) needs a 'Status' picklist on three separate objects and wants to share the list of values. Which feature should be used?
explanation: Global Value Sets allow multiple picklist fields on different objects to use a single set of values.

question: Which Lightning component should the app builder add to the layout to display a custom 'New Task' action?
explanation: Task-based actions are displayed in the Activities component (activity timeline) in Lightning.

question: The marketing team needs to see the sales team's Accounts, but they are in different branches of the role hierarchy. Which feature should be used?
explanation: Sharing rules are used to grant access to groups of users across different role hierarchy branches.

question: DreamHouse Realty wants a weather map on listing records only when a showing is scheduled. How should the builder meet this?
explanation: Component visibility allows you to show/hide Lightning components based on record criteria (e.g., if a date is not null).

question: Which two behaviors should be considered when creating a relationship between the Training object and related Student records?
options: Users can set up Roll-up summary fields on Student records.
Cross-object field updates are not supported.
The Student Lookup field can be made optional.
Users can only delete Students if they have access to the records.
explanation: In a lookup relationship, the field can be optional, and standard object-level permissions apply for deletion.

question: Sales reps want a way to add new contacts quickly on mobile and follow up later. Which solution is recommended?
options: Use Path and set pre-defined values.
Build a global action to create Contacts.
Add a compact layout to Contacts.
explanation: Global Actions provide a simplified form to create records quickly on the go.

question: How should an app builder prevent accounts with open opportunities from being deleted?
options: Remove Delete permission from the Sales Rep profile.
Remove the delete button on the account layout.
Create a validation rule on the Account object.
Create an Apex Trigger on the Account object.
explanation: Validation rules cannot block deletions; an Apex trigger is the only way to perform cross-object logic during a delete operation.

question: NTO wants to track the total number of trails a park has without writing code. Which two actions are required?
options: Use a master-detail relationship between the objects.
Use a lookup relationship between the objects.
Use a roll-up summary field on the Park record.
Use a formula field on the Park record.
explanation: A Master-Detail relationship is required to use the Roll-up Summary field type declaratively.

question: Which component should be on a Lightning Record Page to see all fields from the page layout?
explanation: The Record Detail component renders the fields as they are configured in the standard Page Layout editor.

question: Which two formulas will accomplish the requirement of showing priority flags (Red, Yellow, Green)?
options: A rule using IF and ISPICKVAL for the file path.
A rule using CASE for the file path.
explanation: The IMAGE() function is necessary to display the graphic files based on conditional logic.

question: When an opportunity is closed won, a renewal should be created and the contracts team notified. Which solution meets this?
explanation: Record-triggered flows are ideal for creating related records and initiating notifications simultaneously.

question: What is the effect of creating a master-detail relationship if users want to report on Galaxy with Stars?
options: A report type will be automatically created.
A new custom report type will need to be created.
A report type with lookup fields will be required.
A Galaxy with Star report type is automatically created.
explanation: Custom report types are often necessary to ensure specific fields or primary object relationships are correctly reflected.

question: CK wants to show a text notification on a case when the related account is Platinum-level. How can this be met?
options: Create a custom LWC and assign it to a cloned layout.
Clone the Case Lightning page and assign it to platinum accounts.
Add a rich text component to the Case page and set component visibility.
Create a custom LWC and drag it into the layout.
explanation: Component visibility on the Lightning Record Page is the most efficient declarative way to show alerts.

question: Once a job offer is accepted, the date of hire should be entered and not changed on subsequent edits. Which formula?
options: A formula using ISCHANGED and checking if the offer is already accepted.
A formula using NOT(ISNEW) and ISCHANGED(Date_of_Hire).
explanation: Combining NOT(ISNEW()) and ISCHANGED() prevents editing an existing field value.

question: A sandbox is on a newer version than production. What should the app builder consider when planning deployment?
options: The change set will automatically deploy later.
The deployment is not possible due to version difference.
It will fail if there is a feature only available in the next version.
explanation: Deployments between different Salesforce versions fail if the package contains metadata not yet supported in the target environment.

question: CK wants to track gift cards and ensure they cannot be moved across Accounts once created. Which field type?
explanation: Master-detail relationships can be configured to prevent reparenting, locking the child record to its parent.

question: What should be considered when deploying an auto-launched flow to production in an active state?
options: User access needs to be granted.
Verify there is an Apex test that provides test coverage for the flow.
Manually activate the flow after deployment.
explanation: Salesforce requires Apex test coverage for flows to be deployed in an active status.

question: The marketing team has a list of 400 leads and wants to avoid creating duplicates. Which two actions?
options: Upload using the Import Wizard and select a Matching Type.
Utilize a Lead Matching Rule and Duplicate Rule to block creation.
explanation: The Import Wizard has native deduplication, and Duplicate Rules can block creation of duplicates via other entry points.

question: Which three action types should an app builder use in the approval process?
explanation: Standard approval actions include Email Alerts, Tasks, Field Updates, and Outbound Messages.

question: Users report unexpected access levels after a process updates record ownership. Which two considerations?
options: Processes that update owners do not transfer child records.
Processes use the first value if updated multiple times.
Processes fail on records owned by inactive users.
Processes only run if the current version is active.
explanation: Changing a parent owner via process does not automatically re-assign child records, and inactive owners cause process failures.

question: A manager wants to provide a help guide during the different sales processes. Which solution?
explanation: The Path component provides guidance for success and key fields at each stage of a process.

question: When an opportunity is closed date is pushed more than 30 days, manager approval is required. An approval process is in place but reps frequently forget to submit for approval to run the process.How can an app builder ensure that these opportunities are submitted into the approval process?
options: Change entry criteria on the approval process.
Submit the record for approval from an automated process.
Give the manager API Enabled permission.
Use a validation rule and email alert.
explanation: Flows can include an 'Action' to submit a record to an approval process automatically when criteria are met.

question: What happens if an employee attempts to edit a field after submitting an opportunity for approval?
options: User sees the record is now owned by the manager.
User can edit some fields but not others.
User will be presented with a 'Record Lock' notification.
User can edit only specified fields.
explanation: Approval processes lock records by default, preventing any edits until the process is completed.

question: Which field type allows descriptions that include pictures and links?
explanation: Rich Text Area fields support formatted text, images, and hyperlinks.

question: What is needed to ensure users can view Request Inventory records (a junction object)?
options: Read access to both master objects.
Sharing rules on the junction object.
Read access to the first master object.
explanation: In a junction object, access to a record is determined by having access to both related master records.

question: Which two report formats can be used as a source report to configure a reporting snapshot?
explanation: Reporting snapshots only support Tabular and Summary reports as their source.

question: A representative wants to collect information using a series of question prompts. What should be used?
explanation: Screen Flows are designed to capture user information through interactive screens and prompts.

question: A custom component is unavailable on the utility bar. How should it be tagged?
options: For use in Lightning App Builder.
For use on the utility bar.
explanation: Components must be enabled for specific Lightning interfaces in their metadata to be visible in the App Builder.
